ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would describe this as a course that close-reads a series of major and diverse American texts, simultaneously trying to trace a series of common themes or issues between them and embracing the uniqueness of each text in very intimate readings during class discussion. I would recommend it to anyone who is working on American literature.

I would summarize Regions, Hemispheres, Oceans as I did in question # 1, and I would recommend the course to every student in the English Department. While Americanists can make direct use of the course materials, other students can apply the courses insights to their own fields.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The wide-ranging array of texts in the course was very useful for expanding my sense of my field in American studies, and the broad theoretical framework for the course will continue to shape my future research and dissertation.

Regions, Hemispheres, Oceans helped me look at American literature from a number of new perspectives. As I begin my dissertation topic, I am excited to maintain the transnational awareness that I developed in this course.
